title: How to Mute and Unmute Tabs in Chrome: Guide + Troubleshooting

steps.title: Right-click the tab you want to mute.
steps.content: Right-click the tab you want to mute. A drop-down menu will open. You can mute a site whether or not it's currently playing audio. When a Chrome tab is actively playing audio, you'll see a volume icon on the tab.

steps.title: Click Mute site.
steps.content: Click Mute site . This is in the middle section of the drop-down menu. The tab will be muted.

steps.title: Unmute the tab.
steps.content: Unmute the tab. To unmute a silenced tab, right-click the tab again and select Unmute site .

steps.title: Disable extensions.
steps.content: Disable extensions. An extension may be affecting the mute/unmute option. Temporarily disable all Chrome extensions , then try muting again.

steps.title: Update Chrome.
steps.content: Update Chrome. If tabs aren't muting properly, make sure Chrome is updated to the latest version. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Enable tab audio muting in the Flags menu.
steps.content: Enable tab audio muting in the Flags menu. This menu has experimental features. [2] X Research source Do the following: Type chrome://flags/ into the address bar and press Enter/Return . Find the Tab audio muting UI control option. Click the drop-down menu. Select Enabled . Restart Chrome.

steps.title: Try an extension instead.
steps.content: Try an extension instead. You can download an extension , such as Mute Tab if the built-in feature isn't working. Once downloaded, activate it in the extensions menu to mute tabs.
